ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to narrow down a research question.
I think this course is a great way to keep us on track for completing the senior thesis and getting updates of what everyone else is working on!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Strong organization, good feedback from professors, very supportive financially and in terms of mentorship, great interactions between other members of the colloquium, keeps you on track with finishing your thesis.

Weaknesses: Small thing but it would be nice to have presentations held in a smaller room (or all at once, with more audience members) as it was almost too big a room to really engage and ask questions. I don't think the library session is super helpful; maybe we could have a more specific training on Zotero or qualitative research tools or GIS?

I really enjoyed getting to meet with other seniors and hear about their research methods and processes. It was great to be in a group with others coming from a variety of different academic disciplines and backgrounds, because I got to learn about how research is approached from those perspectives and how to discuss work across disciplines. 
The early assignments were not necessarily particularly useful to my final project in the form I submitted them, but I think they work well in that they function as deadlines for making important decisions (research question, what sources to use, etc.).

The meeting schedule was a bit disorganized. Certain weeks I wasnt sure if we would meet or not. Sometimes Id come into the classroom assuming we were meeting, but we didnt. Overall the colloquium wasnt really helpful. If anything the time could have been better used to work on thesis independently. I think the structured class meeting times should be replaced by optional office hours. It felt like a waste of time to come in and sit there for 40 minutes, maybe sharing a piece of evidence with others. In addition, the assignment timeline seemed a bit delayed. I would have preferred assignments be due a week or two earlier than they actually were this semester, in order to better keep us students on track. For example, the thesis outline felt like it came out of nowhere, in addition to the thesis draft. The assignments before felt too basic and easy to fulfill, like a piece of data or evidence or a few sources.
It would be nice if the weekly assignments corresponded more to writing the real thesis
I think the strengths are the discussions we have as a mentor group, but one way to improve the course would be to make the increase in workload a little more gradual over the course of the semester

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: The EVST major is fantastic, and though the thesis process is daunting, you are very supportive through faculty, other advisors, and your peers. Highly recommend the major and capping it off with this colloquium class which really brings folks together in senior year.
This was a great way to write my senior essay alongside friends in the EVST community.
You have no choice but to take the colloquium as an EVST major, but I think the structure of the colloquium could be improved (ie change to optional office hours)
yes! i think you hvae to take it as evst but the class meetings are definitely helpful for progress on the thesis
